Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the number of Muslim Americans by suggesting that the United States would be one of the largest Muslim countries in the world.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support or evidence to back up the assertion that the United States would be one of the largest Muslim countries.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the number of Muslim Americans is significantly higher than the available data suggests.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the available data from the CIA Online World Factbook, which states that Muslims in the United States make up about 0.6 percent of the population.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating biases in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of alternative explanations being presented in the claim.
